info.title: GitHub
info.description: GitHub is a web-based Git repository hosting service. It offers all of the distributed revision control and source code management (SCM) functionality of Git as well as adding its own features.

post.description: This operation is used to create a new issue for a specific repository.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.description: Gets your public key, which you need to encrypt secrets. You need to encrypt a secret before you can create or update secrets.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

put.summary: Create or update a repository secret
put.description: Creates or updates a repository secret with an encrypted value. Encrypt your secret using LibSodium.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

post.summary: Create a repository using a template
post.description: Creates a new repository using a repository template. The authenticated user must own or be a member of an organization that owns the repository.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred
Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

post.description: Creates a reference for your repository. You are unable to create new references for empty repositories, even if the commit SHA-1 hash used exists. Empty repositories are repositories without branches.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.description: Returns a single reference from your Git database. The `reference` parameter must be formatted as `heads/<branch name>` for branches and `tags/<tag name>` for tags. If the `reference` doesn't match an existing ref, a `404` is returned.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

put.description: This operation is used to merge a pull request for the repository.

409.description: Sha was provided and pull request head did not match

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.description: This operation is used to get a pull request for the repository.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

patch.description: This operation is used to update a pull request for the repository. To update a pull request in a public repository, you must have write access to the head or the source branch. For organization-owned repositories, you must be a member of the organization that owns the repository to open or update a pull request.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.summary: Get the list of files from a pull request
get.description: This operation is used to get the list of files from a pull request for the repository.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

post.description: This operation is to create a pull request in a repository. To open or update a pull request in a public repository, you must have write access to the head or the source branch. For organization-owned repositories, you must be a member of the organization that owns the repository to create a pull request.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

post.description: This operation is to trigger a webhook event called `repository_dispatch` when you want activity that happens outside of GitHub to trigger a GitHub Actions workflow or GitHub App webhook. You must configure your GitHub Actions workflow or GitHub App to run when the `repository_dispatch` event occurs.

get.description: Both `base` and `head` must be branch names in `repositoryName`. To compare branches across other repositories in the same network as `repositoryName`, use the format `<USERNAME>:branch`. The response is equivalent to running the `git log base..head` command; however, commits are returned in chronological order.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

put.summary: Add selected repository to an organization secret
put.description: Adds a repository to an organization secret when the `visibility` for repository access is set to `selected`. The visibility is set when you [Create or update an organization secret](https://developer.github.com/v3/actions/secrets/#create-or-update-an-organization-secret). You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:org` scope to use this endpoint. GitHub Apps must have the `secrets` organization permission to use this endpoint.

204.description: Response when repository was added to the selected list

409.description: Response when visibility type is not set to selected

delete.summary: Remove selected repository from an organization secret
delete.description: Removes a repository from an organization secret when the `visibility` for repository access is set to `selected`. The visibility is set when you [Create or update an organization secret](https://developer.github.com/v3/actions/secrets/#create-or-update-an-organization-secret). You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:org` scope to use this endpoint. GitHub Apps must have the `secrets` organization permission to use this endpoint.

204.description: Response when repository was removed from the selected list

409.description: Response when visibility type not set to selected

post.description: Creates a GitHub Webhook for Pull Requests
post.summary: When a pull request is created or modified

parameters.name: Request body of webhook
parameters.description: This is the request body of the Webhook

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work, create of modify a pullrequest.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.summary: When a new issue is opened and assigned to me
get.description: This operation triggers when an issue is opened and assigned to the logged in user.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, open a new issue in GitHub.

get.summary: When an issue assigned to me is closed
get.description: This operation triggers when an issue assigned to the logged in user is closed.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, close an issue in GitHub.

get.summary: When an issue is assigned to me
get.description: This operation triggers when an issue is assigned to the logged in user.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Unknown error occurred

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, assign an issue in GitHub.

verified.description: Indicates whether GitHub considers the signature in this commit to be verified.

signature.description: The signature that was extracted from the commit.

additions.description: Number of additions in the file

deletions.description: Number of Deletions in the file

changes.description: Number of Changes in the file

status.description: Status of the change modified, renamed etc.,

raw_url.description: Raw Url link to the file

blob_url.description: Blob Url link to the file

patch.description: Actual changes made to the file.

previous_filename.description: Previous FileName if the FileName is changed

url.description: The HTTP URL for the commit.

html_url.description: HTML Url of the parent branch.

client_payload.description: JSON payload with extra information about the webhook event that your action or worklow may use.

status.description: Status of the comparision eg. diverged etc.,

ActionsPublicKey.description: The public key used for setting Actions Secrets.

created_at.description: The date and time when the key was created.

encrypted_value.description: Value for your secret, encrypted with LibSodium using the public key retrieved from the Get an Repository public key action.

key_id.description: ID of the key you used to encrypt the secret.

owner.description: The organization or person who will own the new repository. If left blank, the authenticated user will be the owner.

name.description: The name of the new repository.

description.description: A short description of the new repository.

private.description: Either `true` to create a new private repository or `false` to create a new public one.

key.description: The lowercased SPDX Id of the license.

name.description: The license full name specified by https://spdx.org/licenses.

url.description: URL to the license on https://choosealicense.com.

node_id.description: The Node Id of the repository.

full_name.description: The full name of the repository.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository disabled.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

ref.description: The name of the fully qualified reference (ie: `refs/heads/master`). If it doesn't start with 'refs' and have at least two slashes, it will be rejected.

sha.description: The SHA1 value for this reference.

ref.description: The name of the fully qualified reference.

node_id.description: The Node Id of the reference.

title.description: The title of the new pull request.

head.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

base.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

body.description: The contents of the pull request.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

draft.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft.

commitTitle.description: Title for the automatic commit message.

commitMessage.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.

sha.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge.

mergeMethod.description: Merge method to use. Possible values are `merge`, `squash` or `rebase`. Default is `merge`.

merged.description: Whether or not the pull request was merged.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

body.description: The contents of the pull request.

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

base.description: The name of the branch you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot update the base branch on a pull request to point to another repository.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

Milestone.description: A collection of related issues and pull requests.

url.description: The HTTP URL for the milestone.

html_url.description: The HTML URL for the milestone.

labels_url.description: The labels URL for the milestone.

id.description: The Unique Identifier for the milestone.

node_id.description: The Node ID for the milestone.

open_issues.description: Number of open issues for the repository.

closed_issues.description: Number of closed issues for the repository.

created_at.description: The date and time when the milestone was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the milestone was last updated.

closed_at.description: The date and time when the milestone was closed.

due_on.description: The due date of the milestone.

Label.title: Label
Label.description: Color-coded labels help you categorize and filter your issues (just like labels in Gmail).

id.description: The Unique Identifier for the label.

node_id.description: The Node ID for the label.

description.description: A brief description of this label.

color.description: 6-character hex code, without the leading #, identifying the color

default.description: Whether or not this is a default label.

TeamDetails.title: Team
TeamDetails.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

node_id.description: The Node ID for the team.

members_url.description: The HTTP URL for the team members.

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

privacy.description: The level of privacy this team should have

repositories_url.description: The HTTP URL for this team's repositories.

slug.description: The slug corresponding to the team.

ldap_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) that team maps to within LDAP environment

PullRequest.description: Pull requests let you tell others about changes you've pushed to a repository on GitHub. Once a pull request is sent, interested parties can review the set of changes, discuss potential modifications, and even push follow-up commits if necessary.

url.description: The HTTP URL for this pull request.

id.description: The Unique Identifier for the pull request.

node_id.description: The Node ID for the pull request.

html_url.description: The HTML URL for the pull request.

diff_url.description: The Diff URL for the pull request.

patch_url.description: The patch URL for the pull request.

issue_url.description: The issue URL for the pull request.

commits_url.description: The commit URL for the pull request.

review_comments_url.description: The review comments URL for the pull request.

review_comment_url.description: The review comment URL for the pull request.

comments_url.description: The Diff URL for the pull request.

statuses_url.description: The statuses URL for the pull request.

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the pull request within its repository.

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

locked.description: Whether the pull request is locked or not.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

labels.description: The list of labels associated with the pull request.

active_lock_reason.description: Reason that the conversation was locked.

created_at.description: The date and time when the pull request was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the pull request was last updated.

closed_at.description: The date and time when the pull request was closed.

merged_at.description: The date and time that the pull request was merged.

merge_commit_sha.description: The merge commit Sha of the pull request.

assignees.description: The list of assignees for the pull request.

requested_reviewers.description: The list of Users assigned to this pull request.

requested_teams.description: The list of requested teams to this pull request.

author_association.description: Author's association with the subject of the comment.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

merged.description: Whether or not the pull request was merged.

mergeable.description: Whether or not the pull request can be merged based on the existence of merge conflicts.

rebaseable.description: Whether or not the pull request is rebaseable.

mergeable_state.description: The mergeable state of the pull request.

comments.description: The number of comments in this pull request.

review_comments.description: The number of review comments in this pull request.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

commits.description: The number of commits in this pull request.

additions.description: The number of additions in this pull request.

deletions.description: The number of deletions in this pull request.

changed_files.description: The number of changed files in this pull request.

status.description: The modification status for the file.

additions.x-ms-summary: Number of additions made to the file
additions.description: The number of additions made to the file.

deletions.x-ms-summary: Number of deletions made to the file
deletions.description: The number of deletions made to the file.

changes.x-ms-summary: Number of changes made to the file
changes.description: The number of changes made to the file.

blob_url.description: The blob Url for the file.

raw_url.description: The Raw Url for the file.

contents_url.description: The contents Url for the file.

patch.description: The patch content for the file.

active.description: State of the Trigger, always set to true

templateOwner.name: templateOwner
templateOwner.description: Name of the template repository owner.

reference.name: reference
reference.description: The ref in the URL must be formatted as heads/<branch name> for branches and tags/<tag name> for tags.
